creator: peterj@liberate.com
text:
In certain cases, a pattern in PropertyFile (actually just a DecimalFormat) is
not returned in the exact format provided.  In particular, the returned string
can be longer than the specified pattern, e.g. if the value "99" is incremented
with pattern "00", the returned string is "100".

I've patched this to return the rightmost substring of the value if it's a)
positive; b) longer than the provided pattern; and c) the pattern is completely
numeric.  It's nominally a change in functionality, but has a workaround
(specify a pattern with "#" instead of "0" and you'll get the original behaviour).

creator: jakarta@ehatchersolutions.com
text:
I've made substantial refactorings to the <propertyfile> task.  Although in 
this particular case I don't agree with this patch. We should let DecimalFormat 
do its thing and let the results be exactly what that returns rather than 
modifying it further.  I'm going to mark as WONTFIX, but if you come back with 
more compelling reasons to modify this behavior I'll reconsider.  At the very 
least, truncation should only occur with an optional attribute setting - 
DecimalFormat's results shouldn't be touched unless specifically requested.
